text: The 2010 UEFA Futsal Championship was the sixth official edition of the UEFA- governed European Championship for national futsal teams. It was hosted by Hungary. It was between January 19 and January 30, 2010. There were two venues. One was in Budapest (Papp László Sportaréna) and one in Debrecen (Főnix Arena). For the first time, twelve teams were in the final round. Spain defeated Portugal in the final by 4–2. This was the fifth title in a row for Spain. ==Qualification== Thirty-eight nations took part in the qualifying round. Hungary was selected because they were the host. ===Qualified teams=== Country Qualified as Previous appearances in tournament1 Hungary 00Hosts 1 (2005) Spain 01Group 2 winner 6 (1996, 1999, 2001, 2003, 2005, 2007) Italy 02Group 4 winner 6 (1996, 1999, 2001, 2003, 2005, 2007) Russia 03Group 7 winner 6 (1996, 1999, 2001, 2003, 2005, 2007) Ukraine 04Group 1 winner 5 (1996, 2001, 2003, 2005, 2007) Portugal 05Group 6 winner 4 (1999, 2003, 2005, 2007) Czech Republic 06Group 3 winner 4 (2001, 2003, 2005, 2007) Serbia 07Group 5 runner-up 2 (1999, 2007) Slovenia 08Group 7 runner-up 1 (2003) Belgium 09Group 5 winner 3 (1996, 1999, 2003) Belarus 10Group 4 runner-up 0 (debut) Azerbaijan 11Group 6 runner-up 0 (debut) : 1 Bold indicates champion for that year ==Venues== Arena Papp László Sportaréna Főnix Aréna Picture City Budapest Debrecen Capacity 12,500 8,500 ==Final ranking== align=center Spain align=center Portugal align=center Czech Republic 4 Azerbaijan 5 Russia 5 Italy 5 Ukraine 5 Serbia 9 Belarus 9 Hungary 9 Belgium 9 Slovenia ==Awards== Golden Boot Golden Boot Biro Jade Javi Rodríguez Joel Queirós Saad Assis 5 goals ==Other websites== * 6th UEFA Futsal Championship - Hungary 2010 , Futsal Planet * Official UEFA website Category:2010 in association football Category:Futsal Category:Sport in Budapest Category:21st century in Hungary Category:2010 in Europe Category:Football in Hungary Category:Football competitions in Europe Category:January 2010 events
